owl:Ontology.rdfs:comment: Update implementing the specifiations coming from 'Details of the Asset Administration Shell - Part 1: The exchange of information between partners in the value chain of Industrie 4.0 (Version 1.0)'
owl:Ontology.skos:definition: An Ontology to represents the Reference Architecture Model for Industry 4.0 (RAMI), including the concept of the Administration Shell I4.0 Component.

rdfs:Datatype.rdfs:comment: IRDI - ISO29002-5, ISO IEC 6523 and ISO IEC 11179-6 [20] as an Identifier scheme for properties and classifications. They are created in a process of consortium-wise specification or international standardisation. To this end, users sit down together and feed their ideas into the consortia or standardisation bodies. Properties in ISO, IEC help to safeguard key commercial interests. Repositories like eCl@ss and others make it possible to standardise a relatively large number of Identifiers in an appropriately short time.
A BLOB is a data element that represents a file that is contained with its source code in the value attribute.
rdfs:Datatype.rdfs:label: rami:blob

rdfs:Datatype.rdfs:comment: A File is a data element that represents a file via its path description.
rdfs:Datatype.rdfs:label: rami:file

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A relation between any entities, in this case, the Asset can be part of other Asset(s).
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is Part Of

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Administrative information of an identifiable element. Note: Some of the administrative information like the version number might need to be part of the identification.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has administration

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: The asset the AAS is representing.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: asset

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A reference to a Submodel that defines the handling of additional domain specific (proprietary) Identifiers for the asset like e.g. serial number etc.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has Asset Identification Model

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: An AAS max have one or more concept dictionaries assigned to it. The concept dictionaries typically contain only descriptions for elements that are also used within the AAS (via HasSemantics).
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has concept dictionary

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Referable elements that are contained in the view.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: containedElement

owl:ObjectProperty.skos:definition: Agent(Person or Software) that contributes to the Entity/Object related data. It correspond to the Contributor concept of OMM

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A data element is a submodel element that is not further composed out of other submodel elements. A data element is a submodel element that has a value. The type of value differs for different subtypes of data elements.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: dataElement

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Reference to a submodel defining default environment attributes, i.e. attributes that are not describing the asset itself. The submodel is of kind=Type. At the same type the values of these environment attributes need to be accessible when evaluating the access permission rules. This is realized as a policy information point.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: defaultEnvironmentAttributes

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Reference to a submodel defining the default permissions for the AAS.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: defaultPermissions

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Reference to a submodel defining the default subjects attributes for the AAS that can be used to describe access permission rules. The submodel is of kind=Type.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: defaultSubjectAttributes

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A formula may depend on referable or even external global elements - assumed that can be referenced and their value may be evaluated - that are used in the logical expression.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: dependsOn

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This relation connects instances of AAS with their respective types. Refer to Asset Kind for further information of instance and type kinds.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: derived from

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Connect the Asset with the Administration Shell
First element in the relationship taking the role of the subject.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: first

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: The semantics of a property or other elements that may have a semantic description is defined by a concept description. The description of the concept should follow a standardized schema (realized as data specification template).
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has ConceptDescription

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Global reference to the data specification template used by the element.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has Data Specification

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Points to the datatypes of the Submodels
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has Datatype

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Type of the key value. In case of idType = idShort local shall be true. In case type=GlobalReference idType shall not be IdShort.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has idType

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Unique reference in its name space.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has Key

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A data element that further classifies a specific subject.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has subjectAttribute

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Points to the Admin Shell to the Submodels that describe the Admin Shell of a given Asset
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has Submodel

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Points to the differents views associated to the Administration Shell via the Submodels.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has View

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: the rami:in attribute of rami:operation is the input parameter
The Submodel is in accordance with a given standard specified in the STO ontology
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: in Accordance With

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Connects the Admin Shell with the different RAMI4.0 Dimensions
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is Connected To

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment:
Mime type of the content of the BLOB. The mime type states which file extension the file has. Valid values are e.g. “application/json”, “application/xls”, ”image/jpg” The allowed values are defined as in RFC2046.
or
Mime type of the content of the File.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: mimeType

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Element to which permission shall be assigned.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has object

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A data element that further classifies an object.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: objectAttribute

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: out is the output paramter of the Operation
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: out

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Reference to the next referable parent element of the element. Constraint AASd-004: Add parent in case of non-identifiable elements. Note: This element is used to ease navigation in the model and thus it enables more performant
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: parent

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This is the preferredName of a ConceptDescription object
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: preferredName

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: The qualifier value is the value of the qualifier. Constraint AASd-006: if both, the value and the valueId are present then the value needs to be identical to the short name of the referenced coded value in qualifierValueId.
Second element in the relationship taking the role of the object.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: second

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Reference to a submodel defining which environment attributes can be accessed via the permission rules defined for the AAS, i.e. attributes that are not describing the asset itself. Default: reference to the submodel referenced via defaultEnvironmentAttributes
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: selectableEnvironmentAttributes

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A submodel consists of zero or more submodel elements.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has Submodel Element

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Target object attributes that need to be fulfilled so that the access permissions apply to the accessing subject.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: targetObjectAttributes

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Target subject attributes that need to be fulfilled by the accessing subject to get the permissions defined by this rule.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: targetSubjetAtrtibutes

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Trust anchor of AAS, typically certificates.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: trustAnchor

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: The key value, for example an IRDI if the idType=IRDI.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: keyValue

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: If allowDuplicates=true then it is allowed that the collection contains the same element several times. Default = false
The unique identifier of an asset. Note the difference between the 'asset ID' idenitfier and the URIs for the resources.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: id

owl:DatatypeProperty.skos:definition: Date when an Agent(Person or Software) creates to the Entity/Object related data. It correspond to the Creator concept of OMM

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: This is the definition that is contained in the conceptDescription.
has definition

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Denotes if the key references a model element of the same AAS (=true) or not (=false). In case of local = false the key may reference a model element of another AAS or an entity outside any AAS that has a global unique id.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: has local

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: A globally unique identifier which is NOT a URI.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: identification

owl:DatatypeProperty.skos:definition: Points to the Standard used to describe a given object

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: If ordered=false then the elements in the property collection are not ordered. If ordered=true then the elements in the collection are ordered. Default = false
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: ordered

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Revision of the element. Constraint AASd-005: A revision requires a version. This means, if there is no version there is no revision neither.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: revision

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Container for access control policy points.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Access ControlPolicy Points

owl:Class.dc:source: This definition comprises material from RAMI4.0.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Admin Shell
owl:Class.skos:definition: Describes the Administration Shell for Assets, Products, Components, e.g. Machines

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Every Identifiable may have administrative information. Administrative information includes for example  Information about the version of the element  Information about who created or who made the last change to the element  Information about the languages available in case the element contains text, for translating purposed also themmaster or default language may be defined In the first version of the AAS metamodel only version information as defined by IEC 61360 is defined. In later versions additional attributes may be added.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Administrative Information

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The RAMI4.0 model features one, generalized life-cycle axis, which was derived from IEC 62890. The basic idea is to distinguish for all assets within Industrie 4.0 between possible types and instance. This makes it possible to apply the type/instance distinction for all elements such as material type/material instance, product type/product instance, machine type/ machine instance and more. Business related information will be handled on the 'Business' layer of the RAMI4.0 model, as well, covering also order details and workflows, again with types/ instances.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Asset Kind

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A BLOB is a data element that represents a file that is contained with its source code in the value attribute.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: BlobDataElement

owl:Class.dc:description: "The AAS itself can also define its own dictionary that contains semantic definitions of its submodel elements. These semantic definitions are called concept descriptions (ConceptDescription). It is optional whether an AAS defines its own concept dictionary (ConceptDictionary) or not."

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A dictionary contains elements that can be reused. The concept dictionary contains concept descriptions. Typically a concept description dictionary of an AAS contains only concept descriptions of elements used within submodels of the AAS.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Concept Dictionary

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A data element is a submodel element that is not further composed out of other submodel elements. A data element is a submodel element that has a value. The type of value differs for different subtypes of data elements.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: DataElement

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Element that can have data specification templates. A template defines the additional attributes an element may or shall have.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: DataSpecification

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A File is a data element that represents a file via its path description.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: FileDataElement

owl:Class.dc:description: A formula is used to describe constraints by a logical expression.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Formula

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Element that can have data specification templates. A template defines the additional attributes an element may or shall have.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Has Data Specification

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An element with a kind is an element that can either represent a type or an instance. Default for an element is that it is representing an instance.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Has Kind

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An element that has a globally unique identifier.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Identifiable

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A key is a reference to an element by its id.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Key

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A set of data elements that describe object attributes. These attributes need to refer to a data element within an existing submodel.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Object Attributes

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An operation is a submodel element with input and output variables.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Operation

owl:Class.dc:description: An operation variable is a submodel element that is used as input or output variable of an operation.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Operation Variable

owl:Class.skos:definition: Each order for manufacturing runs through a life cycle and its specifics necessarily have an impact on the production facility during performance of the order

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A property is a data element that has a single value.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Property

owl:Class.dc:description: The qualifier value is the value of the qualifier. Constraint AASd-006: if both, the value and the valueId are present then the value needs to be identical to the short name of the referenced coded value in qualifierValueId.
A qualifier is a type-value pair that makes additional statements w.r.t. the value of the element.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Qualifier

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An element that is referable by its idShort. This id is not globally unique. This id is unique within the name space of the element.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Referable

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Reference to either a model element of the same or another AAs or to an external entity. A reference is an ordered list of keys, each key referencing an element. The complete list of keys may for example be concatenated to a path that then gives unique access to an element or entity.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Reference

owl:Class.dc:description: A reference element is a data element that defines a reference to another element within the same or another AAS or a reference to an external object or entity.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Reference Element

owl:Class.dc:description: A relationship element is used to define a relationship between two referable elements.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: RelationshipElement

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Container for security relevant information of the AAS.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Security

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A Submodel defines a specific aspect of the asset represented by the AAS. A submodel is used to structure the virtual representation and technical functionality of an Administration Shell into distinguishable parts. Each submodel refers to a well-defined domain or subject matter. Submodels can become standardized and thus become submodels types. Submodels can have different life-cycles.
Describe the different types of Data related to the I4.0 Asset
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Submodel

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A submodel element is an element suitable for the description and differentiation of assets.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Submodel Element

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A submodel element collection is a set or list of submodel elements.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: SubmodelElementCollection

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Current value that can be specified through an instanced submodel (for instance in station 2) or through the asset, for example.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Value

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Different views associated to the Administration Shell via the Submodels
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Sicht
View

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: The RAMI4.0 model features one, generalized life-cycle axis, which was derived from IEC 62890. The basic idea is to distinguish for all assets within Industrie 4.0 between possible types and instance. This makes it possible to apply the type/instance distinction for all elements such as material type/material instance, product type/product instance, machine type/ machine instance and more. Business related information will be handled on the 'Business' layer of the RAMI4.0 model, as well, covering also order details and workflows, again with types/ instances.
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Type

rdf:Description.skos:definition: Clearly identifiable asset for the Administration Shell
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An Asset describes meta data of an asset that is represented by an AAS. The asset may either represent an asset type or an asset instance. The asset has a globally unique identifier plus – if needed – additional domain specific (proprietary) identifiers.
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Eindeutig identifizierbarer Gegenstand, der aufgrund seiner Bedeutung in der Informationswelt verwaltet wird
rdf:Description.skos:note: Objects may be known in the form of a type or of an instance. An object in the planning phase is known as a type

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Description or comments on the element. The description can be provided in several languages.
The semantic id might refer to an external information source, which explains the formulation of the submodel (for example an PDF if a standard)
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: semanticId
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Points to the Expression Semantic of the Submodels
